title: Virtual University Cost Analysis: Educational Economics Using Activity-Based Costing (ABC) Model

context.prior_knowledge: Experience with online learning platforms (LMS), understanding of basic economics concepts, and general familiarity with virtual educational environments
context.additional_context: A cost analysis course for virtual university education conducted in a smartphone-centric, constrained technological environment, exploring efficient allocation of educational resources under realistic limitations for professionals

learning_goals: The five core activity types of the ABC model (instructional design, content development, technical support, etc.) can be identified and explained
Indirect costs (system maintenance, monitoring, etc.) incurred in virtual education environments can be calculated with over 80% accuracy
By analyzing the cost allocation for each learning activity, it is possible to propose improvements to the budget structure of educational institutions.
It is possible to establish a strategy for optimizing educational costs under limited technological environments (smartphone-centric).

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
